== Main Inclusion Report for gnome-disk-utility ==

=== Requirements ===

# ''Availability:'' <nowiki>[[http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/universe/g/gnome-disk-utility]]</nowiki>; available for all supported architectures
# ''Rationale:''
** Used by GNOME 2.27 for disk management
** gvfs Build-Depends on libgdu-dev now
0. ''Security:''
** <nowiki>[[http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvekey.cgi?keyword=gnome-disk-utility|CVE entries]]</nowiki>: None
** <nowiki>[[http://secunia.com/search/?search=gnome-disk-utility|Secunia history]]</nowiki>: None
** Libraries and standard user binary, no suid or gid binaries
** No network activity
0. ''Quality assurance:''
** Used by GNOME (gvfs, nautilus, ...), works out of the box
** No debconf question
** Not in debian yet
** upstream is GNOME and is active
** [http://bugzilla.gnome.org/buglist.cgi?product=gnome-disk-utility]: no critical issue
** Hardware: deal with all sort of disks which are easily available for testing
** no testsuite
0. ''UI standards:''
** User-visible strings are internationalized using standard gettext system
** Use cdbs to update translation template
** End-user applications ship a desktop file
0. ''Standards compliance:'' 
** <nowiki>[[http://www.pathname.com/fhs/|FHS]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://www.de.debian.org/doc/debian-policy/|Debian Policy]]</nowiki> compliant
** Packaging system using standard cdbs
0. ''Dependencies:''
** all in main
0. ''Maintenance:''
** How much maintenance is this package likely to need ?  Normal, it's part of the GNOME desktop and will actively be maintained there
** The package will be maintained by GNOME upstream, the ubuntu desktop team in ubuntu and pkg-gnome in debian
0. ''Background information:''
** The general purpose and context of the package should be clear from the package's debian/control file.
** What do upstream call this software ?  gnome-disk-utility
